verses.verse: Though <WG1437> I speak <WG2980> with the tongues <WG1100> of men <WG444> and of angels, <WG32> and have <WG2192> not charity, <WG26> I am become <WG1096> as sounding <WG2278> brass, <WG5475> or <WG2228> a tinkling <WG214> cymbal. <WG2950>

And though <WG1437> I have <WG2192> the gift of prophecy, <WG4394> and understand <WG1492> all <WG3956> mysteries, <WG3466> and all <WG3956> knowledge; <WG1108> and though <WG1437> I have <WG2192> all <WG3956> faith, <WG4102> so <WG5620> that I could remove <WG3179> mountains, <WG3735> and have <WG2192> not charity, <WG26> I am <WG1510> nothing. <WG3762>

And though <WG1437> I bestow <WG5595> all <WG3956> my goods <WG5224> to feed <WG5595> the poor, <WG4434> and though <WG1437> I give <WG3860> my body <WG4983> to be burned, <WG2545> and have <WG2192> not charity, <WG26> it profits <WG5623> me nothing. <WG3762>
Charity <WG26> suffers <WG3114> long, <WG3114> and is kind; <WG5541> charity <WG26> envies <WG2206> not; charity <WG26> braggs <WG4068> not itself, is not puffed <WG5448> up,
Does not behave <WG807> itself unseemly, seeks <WG2212> not her own, <WG1438> is not easily provoked, <WG3947> thinks <WG3049> no <WG3756> evil; <WG2556>
Rejoices <WG5463> not in iniquity, <WG93> but rejoices <WG4796> in the truth; <WG225>
Bears <WG4722> all <WG3956> things, believes <WG4100> all <WG3956> things, hopes <WG1679> all <WG3956> things, endures <WG5278> all <WG3956> things.

Charity <WG26> never <WG3763> fails: <WG1601> but whether <WG1535> there be prophecies, <WG4394> they shall fail; <WG2673> whether <WG1535> there be tongues, <WG1100> they shall cease; <WG3973> whether <WG1535> there be knowledge, <WG1108> it shall vanish <WG2673> away. <WG2673>
For we know <WG1097> in part, <WG3313> and we prophesy <WG4395> in part. <WG3313>
But when <WG3752> that which is perfect <WG5046> is come, <WG2064> then <WG5119> that which is in part <WG3313> shall be done <WG2673> away. <WG2673>

When <WG3753> I was a child, <WG3516> I spoke <WG2980> as a child, <WG3516> I understood <WG5426> as a child, <WG3516> I thought <WG3049> as a child: <WG3516> but when <WG3753> I became <WG1096> a man, <WG435> I put <WG2673> away <WG2673> childish <WG3516> things.

For now <WG737> we see <WG991> through <WG1223> a glass, <WG2072> darkly; <WG1722> <WG135> but then <WG5119> face <WG4383> to face: <WG4383> now <WG737> I know <WG1097> in part; <WG3313> but then <WG5119> shall I know <WG1921> even <WG2531> as also <WG2532> I am known. <WG1921>
And now <WG3570> stays <WG3306> faith, <WG4102> hope, <WG1680> charity, <WG26> these <WG5023> three; <WG5140> but the greatest <WG3187> of these <WG5130> is charity. <WG26>
